weather_report:
In Evanston, Illinois, current conditions reveal a chilly night with temperatures in the upper teens and clear skies, offering a serene view of Lake Michigan. The air is crisp, inviting a contemplative stroll along the waterfront, although a blustery northwest wind stirs, creating a sense of chill that notably enhances the feel of cold. As the night progresses, occasional snow showers are anticipated, introducing a blanket of white that may cloak the landscape, complemented by gusty winds that could make it feel even colder.

Looking ahead to Thursday, the morning may reveal scattered snow showers, transitioning into mostly sunny skies by midday. Temperatures are expected to inch up to the upper 20s, though they will drop slightly in the afternoon. The wave conditions will likely be moderate, presenting a picturesque backdrop of rolling waves against the shore. For those brave enough to venture outside, dressing warmly in layers, including insulated jackets and hats, will be essential for comfort. As we remain in the grip of winter, these conditions are typical for early December in the Midwest, scoring easily on the chilly side of the comfort spectrum. Seasonal activities like a brisk walk highlighted by the beauty of winter can still make for an enjoyable day, even as the holiday season approaches with cheer in the air.
